turn.0: ELI5: why is the sky in space around the sun dark and not in daylight?
turn.1: All the planets revolve around the sun, so each planet has a day and night cycle. The sun never sets because it stays still. Space is always dark because there is no light there.
turn.2: Does space not get light from the sun?
turn.3: Parts yes, but not the whole of space. When you say “space” do you understand how big “space” is? The sunlight cannot reach that far.
turn.4: Space is the distance between the sun earth and moon with the planet's all in between
turn.6: I'm useless with the imperial system. What is that in centre meters?
